name: Driver AI
headline: Understand millions of lines of code in minutes.
description:
Driver AI is the new way to write technical documentation. It helps everyone in an organization write interactive documents to explain millions of lines of code in minutes instead of months.

WHO: We partner with chip manufacturing, enterprise IT, and software product development teams.

WHY: Traditionally, these teams spend millions and wait months (sometimes years) to understand their complex technology infrastructure well enough to build on top of it. 

THE DRIVER DIFFERENCE: Instead, Driver AI is a tool that explains complex codebases in minutes vs. months. This enables teams to rapidly accelerate the technical discovery process and save significant resources. 

HOW IT WORKS: Driver AI works by digesting a codebase, organizing it for analysis, and harnessing Large Language Models (LLMs) to generate interactive explanations for executives, product and technology leaders, and developers.

"Driver AI is a paradigm shift for managing our complex software delivery pipeline." - Executive Vice President, Global Semiconductor Company

founders.name: Adam Tilton, Founder
founders.description: Adam was the co-founder of Aktive, an embedded machine learning development platform that he sold to Nike in 2019, and Rithmio, which he sold to Bosch Sensortec in 2017 (part of the the BHI260AP). Adam did his B.S., M.S., and Ph.D. (abd) at the University of Illinois in Urbana Champaign in Mechanical Engineering, Computer Science, and Control and Estimation, respectively.

founders.name: Daniel Hensley, Founder
founders.description: Daniel was co-founder and Head of Engineering at Infinity AI. Before that, he helped run the boutique software engineering firm Edge Analytics. In 2017, Daniel completed a PhD at UC Berkeley, developing methods for Magnetic Particle Imaging. He then led software engineering at Magnetic Insight, a startup he and others spun out of Berkeley to commercialize this technology.

Legacy Modernization. Legacy code is expensive to maintain and impossible to understand.[Learn more](https://www.driverai.com/<./legacy-modernization>).
```
 def create
  report = ErrorReport.new(notice_params)
  if report.valid?
   if report.should_keep?
    report.generate_notice!
    api_xml = report.notice.to_xml(only: false, methods: [:id]) do |xml|
     xml.url locate_url(report.notice.id, host: Errbit::Config.host)
    end
    render xml: api_xml
   else
    render body: "Notice for old app version ignored"
   end
  else
   render body: "Your API key is unknown", status: :unprocessable_entity
  end
```

```
    report.generate_notice!
    api_xml = report.notice.to_xml(only: false, methods: [:id]) do |xml|
     xml.url locate_url(report.notice.id, host: Errbit::Config.host)
    end
    render xml: api_xml
   else
    render body: "Notice for old app version ignored"
   end
  else
   render body: "Your API key is unknown", status: :unprocessable_entity
  end
```

generated_description:
**Driver AI: Revolutionizing Technical Documentation**

**Overview**  
Founded in 2023 and part of Y Combinator Batch W24, Driver AI is on a mission to transform how organizations handle technical documentation. By leveraging the power of advanced AI, specifically Large Language Models (LLMs), Driver AI helps teams write interactive documents to comprehend complex codebases in mere minutes rather than the traditional months of effort.

**The Problem**  
In industries like chip manufacturing, enterprise IT, and software development, understanding intricate technology infrastructures is often a cumbersome, resource-draining process. Teams can spend millions and wait for years to grasp the complexities of their systems well enough to innovate further. This is where Driver AI steps in.

**The Solution**  
Driver AI offers a unique tool that analyzes codebases quickly, generating contextual, interactive explanations tailored for various audiences—from executives to developers. This capability not only accelerates the technical discovery process but also significantly reduces costs associated with prolonged documentation efforts. In a world where speed and clarity can set an organization apart, Driver AI provides the edge.

**How It Works**  
1. **Connect Your Codebase**: Users start by integrating their code repository with Driver AI.
2. **Generate Documentation**: The platform digests the code and creates data-rich, contextual documentation.
3. **Get Back to Building**: With documentation accurately produced in no time, teams can refocus their energies on developing innovative solutions.

**Why It Matters**  
As modern organizations evolve, they face the problem of knowledge gaps. Driver AI effectively bridges these gaps by ensuring that documentation is not just a checklist item, but a dynamic resource that evolves with the project. This has been particularly highlighted by CTOs and VP-level professionals from various companies who emphasize the platform’s capability to close the knowledge loop and streamline documentation processes.

**Our Commitment**  
Located in Silicon Valley and staffed by a dedicated team of 11, Driver AI is committed to empowering companies to document their software delivery pipelines securely and efficiently, adhering to industry standards like SOC 2 Type II compliance.

As quoted by an executive from a leading semiconductor company, “Driver AI is a paradigm shift for managing our complex software delivery pipeline.” And with testimonials echoing this sentiment, it’s clear that in a complex tech landscape, Driver AI is the tool that can keep organizations agile and informed.

**Join the Revolution**  
If your organization struggles with documentation and speed, consider exploring how Driver AI can streamline your processes so you can focus on what really matters: building extraordinary things. Check out more on their [website](https://www.driverai.com/) and book a demo to get started.
